book.book_title: THE LETTER OF PAUL TO THE ROMANS
book.title: Greeting
book.note: Or "nations"; the same Greek word can be translated "nations" or "Gentiles" depending on the context
book.title: Paul Wants to Visit Rome
The Gospel's Power for Salvation
God's Wrath Revealed Against Sinful Humanity
book.note: Or "nations"; the same Greek word can be translated "nations" or "Gentiles" depending on the context
Or "But the one who is righteous will live by faith" (differing only in word order)
book.title: God Hands Sinful Humanity over to Depravity
The Righteous and Impartial Judgment of God
Jews also Condemned by the Law
book.note: Or "do you dishonor God?" (a number of translators and interpreters take this phrase as a final rhetorical question; the present translation regards it as a final summary statement to be taken ironically)
book.title: Jews Still Have an Advantage
The Entire World Guilty of Sin
book.note: Verses 10-12 are a quotation from Ps 14:1-3
A quotation from Ps 5:9 and Ps 140:3
Verses 15-17 are a quotation from Isa 59:7-8
book.title: Righteousness through Faith Revealed
book.note: Lit. "all flesh will not be declared righteous"
Or "through the faithfulness of Jesus Christ"
book.title: Abraham's Faith Counted as Righteousness
The Promise to Abraham Secured through Faith
book.note: Some manuscripts have "could be credited to them also"
Lit. "of the in uncircumcision faith of our father Abraham"
Some manuscripts have "already as good as dead"
book.title: Reconciliation with God through Faith in Christ
book.note: Although a number of important manuscripts read the subjunctive mood here ("let us have"), almost all English versions prefer the indicative mood ("we have") which is supported by many other manuscripts
book.title: Death Came through Adam but Life Comes through Christ
book.note: Lit. "but not like the trespass so also the gift"
book.title: Formerly Dead to Sin, Now Alive in Christ
book.note: The elliptical phrase "identified with him in the likeness" has been supplied in the translation for clarity
book.title: Set Free from Sin
Released from the Law through Death
Knowledge of Sin Comes through the Law
Internal Conflict with Sin
Set Free from the Law of Sin and Death
The Glory that is to be Revealed
Victory in Christ
Israel's Rejection
God's Sovereign Choice to Show Mercy
book.note: Or perhaps "by one act of sexual intercourse"
Lit. "for the Lord will act, closing the account and cutting short"
book.title: The Righteousness of God through Faith in Christ
A Remnant of Israel Remains
book.note: Or perhaps "males," referring to men only
book.title: Gentile Branches Grafted in
All Israel to be Saved
book.note: Some manuscripts have "perhaps he will not spare you either"
book.title: A Life Dedicated to God
A Variety of Gifts in the Body of Christ
Living in Love
Obedience to the Governing Authorities
Love Fulfills the Law
book.note: Due to the very compressed style in this verse, many words must be supplied to make sense in English
Some manuscripts have "let us lay aside"
book.title: Do Not Pass Judgment on One Another
book.note: Some manuscripts have "an account concerning himself to God"

line.word: what_edifies_one_another.136 τὰ τῆς οἰκοδομῆς τῆς εἰς ἀλλήλους

book.note: Lit. "the things of edification toward one another"
Some manuscripts omit "or is offended or is weakened"
book.title: Accept One Another according to Christ's Example
Paul's Ministry to the Gentiles
book.note: Some manuscripts have "of the Spirit of God"
book.title: Paul's Travel Plans
Many Personal Greetings
book.note: Or "a deaconess"; some interpreters understand this term to refer to a specific office (deacon/deaconess) which Phoebe held in the local church at Cenchrea
Or "Junias," the masculine form of the same name
book.title: Concluding Exhortations
Greetings from Paul's Associates
book.note: Some manuscripts include vv. 25-27, "25 Now to the one who is able to strengthen you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery that had been kept secret for eternal ages, 26 but now has been revealed, and through the prophetic scriptures has been made known according to the command of the eternal God, resulting in obedience of faith to all the Gentiles, 27 to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ, to whom be the glory for eternity. Amen."
